bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 161, Number 75 (Friday, May 15, 2015)][Pages H3253-H3254]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. YOUNG of Alaska:H.R. 2386.[[Page H3254]]Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article IV, Section 3, Clause 2 and Article I, Section 8,Clause 3.

item.title: Unrecognized Southeast Alaska Native Communities Recognition and Compensation Act

latestAction.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on Public Lands, Forests, and Mining. Hearings held. With printed Hearing: S.Hrg. 114-490.

item.title: Alaska Native Claims Settlement Improvement Act of 2016

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

item.title: Alaska Native Claims Settlement Improvement Act of 2016

latestAction.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Hearings held. Hearings printed: S.Hrg. 114-509.

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Indian, Insular and Alaska Native Affairs.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

summary.text:
Unrecognized Southeast Alaska Native Communities Recognition and Compensation Act

Amends the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act to permit the Native residents of each of the Native Villages of Haines, Ketchikan, Petersburg, Tenakee, and Wrangell, Alaska, to organize as Urban Corporations and to receive certain settlement land pursuant to this Act.

Authorizes those Urban Corporations to establish a settlement trust to promote the health, education, and welfare of the trust beneficiaries, and preserve the Native heritage and culture of their communities.

bill.title: Unrecognized Southeast Alaska Native Communities Recognition and Compensation Act

item.title: Unrecognized Southeast Alaska Native Communities Recognition and Compensation Act
To provide for the recognition of certain Native communities and the settlement of certain claims under the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act, and for other purposes.
Unrecognized Southeast Alaska Native Communities Recognition and Compensation Act

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
